summary: Henry F. Graff is mentioned in several documents related to the Assassination Records Review Board's (ARRB) efforts to declassify and release JFK assassination records. While the documents do not explicitly detail Graff's role or involvement, his name appears in the context of the ARRB's work, suggesting he may have been involved in the review or declassification process. The documents include letters, memoranda, and biographies related to the ARRB's activities, indicating Graff's presence within the scope of the ARRB's operations concerning the JFK assassination records.
key_connections: Director of Central Intelligence George Tenet
significance: The significance of Henry F. Graff in the JFK context is not explicitly defined in the provided documents. His name appears within the context of the ARRB's activities, suggesting he may have been involved in the review or declassification process of JFK assassination records. Further information would be needed to determine the extent and nature of his involvement.
